description.narrative: Critical bottlenecks are addressed to ensure gender equity at pre-primary, primary, and secondary levels of education, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable participation in and completion of quality, inclusive education

sector.narrative: System strengthening - gender-responsive teaching and learning (excluding SRGBV)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Critical bottlenecks are addressed to ensure gender equity at pre-primary, primary, and secondary levels of education

description.narrative: To address gender-related learning bottlenecks, UNICEF is piloting a remedial education support programme in 50 schools. UNICEF tackled harmful traditional gender norms by supporting a nationwide communications campaign and designed gender-responsive pedagogy training manual. UNICEF supported the Ministry of Education to develop a National Communications Strategy on gender and education | Status:Met | As-of Date:01/10/2018

title.narrative: Programming strategies in place to improve the learning of girls and boys in target districts
National education sector plan/policies supports a minimum package of gender-responsive teaching and learning
